duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead all aspects of the company’s safety culture and create awareness by demonstrating commitment to an injury-free environment through individual actions and mentoring others.
Manage and oversee company staff, subcontractors, suppliers and programs such as Safety, Quality, and EEOC for a small project or a major portion of a larger project.
Develop work plans for subcontractors and self-performed work. Coordinate and manage the care, custody, and control of the project site.
Create, manage, change, and implement the project’s schedule as needed, in conjunction with the Project Manager.
Responsible for tracking and monitoring project budget and costs by using the project management system’s cost reports and data from the project manager.
Coordinate activities with the owner, architect, and governing authorities. Understand and apply the terms and conditions of the owner and subcontractor contracts for the project.
Identify, understand, and actively manage project risks. Utilize awareness, experience, and knowledge to identify problems and recommend solutions for review and implementation by the team.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED. Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering, or related field (Preferred)
